alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Johnson; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cedar, central Johnson, north central Washington and northwestern Muscatine Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1130 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Tiffin, or 9 miles west of Iowa City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Coralville and Tiffin around 1140 PM CDT. University Heights, Hills and Oakdale around 1145 PM CDT. Iowa City around 1150 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include West Branch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 234 and 259. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
